Python.why: A core programming language in data science, automation, and web development.
Python.impact: Makes you versatile in automation, data analysis, and backend systems.

SQL.why: Essential for querying and managing relational databases.
SQL.impact: Helps extract insights from structured data efficiently.

Excel.why: Fundamental tool for business analytics and reporting.
Excel.impact: Boosts data analysis and reporting proficiency in any role.

Statistics.why: Foundation for data analysis, hypothesis testing, and machine learning.
Statistics.impact: Equips you for roles in data analysis and experimentation.

Power BI.why: Popular BI tool for interactive visual dashboards and data storytelling.
Power BI.course: Getting Started with Power BI – Coursera
Power BI.impact: Enables impactful business reporting and visualization.

HTML.why: The standard markup language for web development.
HTML.impact: Builds the foundation for frontend development.

CSS.why: Used to style and layout web pages visually.
CSS.impact: Enhances your ability to create visually appealing interfaces.

JavaScript.why: Key scripting language for client-side web development.
JavaScript.impact: Empowers you to create dynamic web applications.

React.why: Modern JS library for building user interfaces.
React.impact: Highly valued for frontend engineering roles.

Git.why: Version control system to track code changes.
Git.course: Introduction to Git and GitHub – Coursera
Git.impact: Supports team collaboration and source code management.

Machine Learning.why: The backbone of modern AI systems.
Machine Learning.impact: Makes you capable of building intelligent predictive models.

Pandas.why: Essential Python library for data manipulation and analysis.
Pandas.impact: Speeds up your ability to analyze structured data efficiently.
